intro: Scorzonera quitensis, commonly known as the Andean scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, thriving in cool and arid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Scorzonera quitensis is also valued for its edible roots, which are used in traditional Andean cuisine.
